reasoning: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv or familial amyloid polyneuropathy) is extremely rare, <0.1 per 100k globally. Higher in endemic areas (Portugal, Sweden, Japan) due to founder mutations. Incidence of symptomatic disease estimated <0.01 per 100k in non-endemic populations.
source: Schmidt HH et al. (2003). Roswell Park Cancer Institute, hereditary amyloidosis review. Amyloid. 10(Suppl 1):85-93
